Reviews.Title: “great hotel =)”
Reviews.Author: Serena H
Reviews.Content: young adult travelled with parents from april 6th to 14, 2012 ROOM AND AMENITIES triple room, # 5, large room and bathroom, clean outside and inside had king size bed and single bed furniture might be a bit old, matresses were so comfortable and felt as it they were bought yesterday. included tv, desk, closet, valet, safe that can be programmed by the visitor and refrigerator bathroom had bathtub, sink, bidet, toilet and lots of counter space (not necessarily attached to the sink but in the bathroom which is good). soap, shampoo, body lotion, bubble bath liquid, q-tips, sponge to clean shoes and shower cap also provided. also includes blow drier and towel warmer. fresh towels are provided daily. wifi available with fee - 2 euros for 6 hours. log on/log off process to be followed to take full advantage of time. elevator, 6 people can comfortably ride in it or 3 people with luggage bar available 24 hours at a fee... my dad had an espresso for 2.50 euros umbrellas are available just before you exit hotel (around 6) taxi to and from airport can be arranged in advance for 55 euros (must call the hotel before you arrive to arrange if from airport to hotel) BREAKFAST from 7am to 10am buffet style, so don't be shy to ask for refills on coffee in the morning croissants, bread, toast is on the house but you must ask for it, so much choice of jams, butter your choice of coffee from cappucino to espresso to hot chocolate yogurt, cereal, crackers cheese and ham cake and pannettone apples, oranges and kiwis 2 types of juices, milk, water (fizzy and natural) canned fruit and fruit salad if you would like something special like an omelette, there is a small fee (around 2.50 euros) HOTEL STAFF the breakfast host, Carla, was amazing. we got to know her personally and grew very attached to her. she was a doll and our farewell was emotional for all of us. super sweet lady and left an impression on our hearts. hotel desk is always willing to help with anything. we had some trouble with our wifi and our minutes ran out super quickly to which we didn't know the reason why. i later understood how to log off... regardless, they gave us wifi for free for 5 hours. LOCATION a bit far from the city center. but it's right next to a bus that takes 5 minutes to get to Termini station (a lot of buses and both major metro lines of rome available). if you walk along Nomentana to the cross street Torlonia, there's the 62 bus. it goes to the major city center (via del corso, st peter's basilica). although it may get crowded on the bus it's worth it 'cause it's the fastest way around. because it's not in the city center, the hotel is quiet and in a safe neighbourhood. RESTAURANTS AROUND HOTEL WORTH YOUR WHILE (1) MERCURI - #65, Viale 21 Aprile (cross street Giacomo Boni, 15 mins away walking distance from hotel) - cafeteria/pick up and go style of restaurant, super good food, freshly made and various selection of pizza, pastas, salads and side dishes. great value for your buck. paid around 30 euros for such a good meal that filled us for the next 7 hours. my mom stated that they had the best eggplant parmigiana she ever tasted in her life. in all the restaurants we went to, this one was the best! (2) XIN DU - #13 Viale 21 Aprile (near Via Ridolfino Venuti, 10 mins walking distance away from hotel) - chinese cuisine, a la carte selection. very freshly made a great change from all the pastas and pizzas we had. we all took soup, spring rolls and ordered three dishes that we shared. it filled us up and was cheap (25 euros). we never though we would eat in a chinese restaurant, reading an english menu in an italian country... ironic but so cool. very good service and food. (3) MARINARI GELATERIA - #97 Corso Trieste (cross street Viale Gorizia which is the street right next to the hotel, 10 minutes walking distance from hotel) - had a bunch of selection of gelato, around 20-25. very cheap too. one of the cheapest we found in rome. (2.20 euros for medium size cup). (4) RISTORANTE CARLO MENTA - #101 Via della Lungaretta (not near to hotel but in Trastevere... take 62 bus and then switch off to take Tram 8, get off after too stops and you'll be in proximity to the restaurant, around 30-40 minutes away from hotel in all; it's worth it though) - we took from their fixed menu 13 euros per person and we all got to chose from a fixed menu with one choice of appetizer (bruschetta), 4 choices of entree, 4 choice of a main dish and 3 choices of dessert. the cover charge is only included in the fixed menu... so if you take from their wide selection of dishes (people sitting next to us had lamb and pizza), the cover charge is 1.50 euros per person. hope this information helps. to anyone who's going to rome, enjoy it. it's simply beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: NordSL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit far from the center of Rome, but in very calm and attractive district. If you like old-fasion hotels with very specific charm, this place is for you. Actually, it's a villa (and it looks like other nice villas) with a small garden (go there for breakfast!). The nearest metro station is in 10-15 minutes walk, so, if you prefer metro, be ready to regular walks. We stayed there for 5 nights and felt no problem with getting in and out of center. Our room was clean, but furniture were rather old (we decided, that it's a kind of charm of this place). But the main advantage of this place were, of course, very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bvlro
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice classical look and it is located in a quite area. Comfortable rooms and good breakfast. The stuff was nice and it is has a beautiful terrace where it is a real pleasure to have your coffee in the morning. The only downside is that the hotel is not located in the city center. But you can get downtown by bus (right next to the hotel) or by metro (about 10 minutes walk).

Reviews.Title: “Another stay at Hotel Villa del Parco”
Reviews.Author: travel2836
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to update my previous review of this hotel. We stayed there 4 nights in October, 2011. We feel at home there. Enjoyed the restaurant close to the hotel - the Pepe Verde. Everyone is helpful at the hotel and the transportation is easy to anywhere in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great refuge from the bustle”
Reviews.Author: viva1986
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before and like that it is not in the heart of touristville. Everyone there is so welcoming and helpful. You feel like you have returned to see a good friend. While this is off the beaten track, the Metro at Piazza Bologna is close and we prefer that to the bus although a main bus will take you into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate, good facilities”
Reviews.Author: ashleync
Reviews.Content: Great newly renovated bathroom and a double bed - bonus for a solo traveler on a budget - not always that way! Lovely outdoor area, though I didn't use it. Great neighbourhood. Only downsides - I sleep with windows open and it was a little noisy on the street - not a big deal, looks like they had a/c, and I could have closed it. Also - had a few problems with public transit. There are multiple lines that run past the hotel, but I only knew of 2 (36/84). When first coming in (on a Sunday) I was told at the termini that those lines didn't run on Sundays, and spent money a few times on cabs before the hotel corrected me - only the 36 didn't run. Also, ran into a few times where buses didn't show or I would end up having problems with connections - so just check when you are leaving the hotel what else runs nearby - the 90 is close, and I believe the 4? There are the streetcars as well...Just hard to be fully informed at times! Also - subway closes at 11:30, buses at 12, and there are a few night buses in a few places, but be prepared that you might need to spend a bit on cabs as well as hotel rates. (About 8-10Euros from the Termini). But facilities were nice, staff was nice. Have to pay a couple Euros for WiFi, but that's just fine!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and going back!”
Reviews.Author: travel2836
Reviews.Content: The dates for our stay did not go back 2 years. We have stayed at this hotel 2 times in the past - the last time was 2 years ago. We are going back in October for 4 nights prior to a cruise. We like staying at this hotel because of the grocery store a few blocks from the hotel, an ATM close by, a wonderful pizza restaurant close by plus other restaurants. Transportation to the city center is great with many bus lines running on Nomentana. The desk clerks help with tickets for the bus or show you where to buy them across the street. They have a very good breakfast - you can special order items for breakfast. It is our home when in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great in so many ways but one problem was insurmountable”
Reviews.Author: sfdrummer
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Villa del Parco in 1998 and returned in May of 2011 because I remembered its beauty, its charm, its lovely garden, and the friendly staff. But unfortunately, my experience this year -- which, I know, is probably unique to me and only a select group of others -- soured me. My traveling companion has severe asthma, and we had checked the website ahead of time to ensure that the hotel offered air conditioning, which she needs when she stays overnight. However, contrary to what the website said, there was no functioning air conditioning at all, and the room was stiflingly hot and unbelievably stuffy, with no air flow even with the windows open. I mean, it was like Dante's inferno in there. My companion simply could not breathe. The clerk was very nice and found us another hotel at about 10:00, but we were also charged for the night, which I think is very bad customer service. (We didn't even stay there!) We arranged for this hotel because the website said there was air conditioning, and there was none. I don't know why we would then be charged for the night, especially because we had to leave for medical reasons at about 10:00 and didn't get to spend the night we were charged for! Because of this, we will not stay there again. If the weather were cooler, and if we didn't have this medical issue, I'm sure things would have been different, so I don't want to steer others away from this charming place. But the poor customer service bids me give it only two stars.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful retreat with interested caring staff”
Reviews.Author: GoldCoastGayle
Reviews.Content: I arrived later in the evening from a long overseas flight and it was nice to be greeted kindly and efficiently. I stayed in an attic room, it was small but I was on my own and I loved it, it was clean and the bed was very comfortable. All the staff were wonderful but I especially liked Maria in the breakfast room she was such a sweetie! The breakfast was very generous and you could enjoy your breakfast or an afternoon wine or beer out in the lovely garden which was a quiet and leafy retreat after a long day walking around the ancient streets of Rome. The location was good, I always prefer to be out a little bit and catch public transport ( 1 euro for 75 mins ) and pay less for my accommodation and be away from the hustle and bustle. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and will definitely return to Hotel Villa del Parco!

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst but too many issues to warrant a repeat stay.”
Reviews.Author: Tgswamps
Reviews.Content: First the bad: Expected air conditioning but the hotel turns it off at the beginning of October because they expect it won't be needed. This necessitates opening the windows for cooling on warm days and that eliminates any possibility of a peaceful stay. The hotel is on a major busy road, so the traffic noise is loud and constant. For the first 2 nights the neighbors alarm kept going off all (I repeat, ALL) night long. To add to the traffic and alarm noise, our room was directly adjacent to the outdoor garden eating/smoking area, so we had that added nuisance all evening. If you stay here, take earplugs, you'll need them. We wouldn't have slept at all without them. The bedspread on the bed was filthy and smelly, but when we put it outside the room, they replaced it with a clean one. Each room seems to be different in size and shape, from tiny to fairly large. Our bathroom was closet size, but I saw 2 others that were more spacious. But there were some positive things: Enrico, the desk clerk was very gracious, friendly, and helpful. The other staff members were fine too but not quite as personable as Enrico. The breakfast was very nice in looks, taste, and presentation. We enjoyed it very much. There is a wonderful restaurant with GREAT pizza about 8 minutes walk away. There is a small church with catacombs about 5 minutes away that was worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “A taste of Rome Italy”
Reviews.Author: Holey59
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day three night trip to Rome staying at the Villa del Parco. Although the hotel is a little distance from the center of Rome, the public transport was readily available.We bought a Roma Pass from the hotel for 23 euro each which gave three day access to metro, bus and tram and also gave free access to the first two attractions with reduced entrance cost thereafter. The metro station (Bologna) is about ten minute walk and the metro system is very easy to use. The 84 bus is from opposite the hotel. We had a Superior room at the top of the hotel(lift available), which promoted the character of the hotel and was of a very good and comfortable standard.Breakfast was good and the staff were very friendly and helpful. A word of warning if going this time of the year, be sure to take mosquito repellent.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Jaxi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is our of the hussle and bussle of Rome, just a bus pleasant bus ride from all the main attractions. It is relaxed and the staff are fantastic, they really go out of their way to help you, nothing is too much. Our room was quite compact and you had to pay for the TV but it was comfortable and the bathroom was huuuge with a really great shower - perfect from all the Rome walking! There is a great restaurant within walking distance that they recommended (The Green Pepper) which had the best pizza ever and no tourists, it was really great! I agree that being out of the city isoe of the strong points of this hotel and the price is really good value. The breakfast was good too. Have a great stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel, personnel very friendly and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Emma097
Reviews.Content: Although not in the centre of Rome, a very convenient bus service took us quickly to all the sites. The Staff were incredibly helpful and accomodating They could not do enough for us. Our particular thanks go to the Manager and Andreana (I do hope I have spelt her name correctly). A charming hotel with parking.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Vazlav
Reviews.Content: Has chosen hotel under Tripadvisor users recommendations. Remained it is very happy with comfort, an arrangement and qualification of the personnel. Though the hotel is located far from city centre, a stop of buses and trolley buses directly near to it (15-20 minutes traffic to Termini). Sometimes we went to the underground "Bologna", these are 10 minutes on foot. The hotel is located in the middle of a garden, and nothing breaks silence. The personnel is very affable, polite and attentive. Room of the average sizes, is quite convenient. A breakfast very good. To complain at all on what.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kbergertrip
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel directly from the hotel website and received the best price for the room. When we arrived, the hotel staff was friendly and willing to offer any assistance we needed. The room was clean and with the windows shut, we could barely hear the noise from the busy street below. However, noise from the room adjoining ours was very easy to hear. The hotel was close (within 5 minute walk) to a bus route going to the metro in one direction and to the heart of Rome and the major tourist attractions in the other direction.

Reviews.Title: “Going to Rome? Stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: CJFLondon
Reviews.Content: Well I've already written a review on this hotel about my experience when I went in April 2005 with two of my friends. I just loved it. So when I went back to Rome this year, this hotel was where I was staying. My sister and aunt came along this time, and they loved it! My aunt's coming back with her husband and my sister, loved Rome and said she's coming back, and this is where she's staying. I just can't praise this hotel and it's staff enough. What really touched me, was on checking in, the receptionist remembered me! Yes, he remembered me from 2005!! Everyone is this hotel is so friendly, there is nothing they won't do for you. The hotel is in a great location; away from the city and tourists but not too far, you can chill out in the garden, take a stroll in the nearby park, jump on a bus (convinently just outside the hotel) and head into town. Nothing more to say really because you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Villa del Parco”
Reviews.Author: WayfaringPair
Reviews.Content: Using the internet, we chose a hotel with a better rate that was away from the tourist area. The bus routes are in front of the hotel. the rooms were big enough and well kept, and the hotel was back from the street. The breakfasts were just fine. The drawback was the aid we got from the desk. They wanted to use their laundry services (expensive as at all hotels) and a Rome bus pass we did not feel we could use. So when we went out to take a bus to a laundromat, we did not get any help on how you pay for a bus ride in Rome. A wonderful Aussie couple bailed us out, and the trip was success. The hotel would have received a much better rating if this desk helped us as desks in other cities had.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: katekuk89
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a short 3 night stay and it turned out to be an excellent choice; this hotel did not disappoint in any way. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and they certainly made us feel very welcome and 'not just some other guests'; we've stayed in many hotels and there was a noticeable difference and genuineness about it. The breakfast was very good and we didn't miss there being no hot options at all. We'd opted to stay outside the centre of Rome before (just further along Nomentana) and, again, this turned out to be a good choice and the location is nothing to worry about. The hotel is well served by several buses, which are both cheap and efficient and the [all] night bus (#60) almost stops outside the gate so you don't have to worry about not being able to stop in town until the early hours to soak up every last drop of atmosphere. The location also has the benefits that you can eat in some very nice backstreet restaurants which are full of the locals (always a good sign) and where prices are not inflated for the tourists. All of the restaurants that were recommended by the hotel turned out to be excellent, including a quieter one almost hidden away near the Spanish Steps - this had great views over Rome. All in all, excellent and definitely worth 4.5/5. I'd easily recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: liveaid
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in this hotel for 4 nights. Initially we thought it was far from the center, but we caught the bus across the street and the ride was really pleasant. The staff was welcoming and kind. The breakfast wonderful in the outdoor terrace. Really had a great online deal. We would definately go back to this romantic place.

Reviews.Title: ““Client is a king” says one in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderX
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my girlfriend during four days in February 2007. This is not my first visit to Rome and I was worrying when looking for a hotel there. My previous experience showed that hotels in Rome are not of very high standards. However, all my worries were for nothing. The description of the hotel on their official web page corresponds entirely or even more what you find there. The room was small but perfectly furnished, very clean and with a lot of light. The bath room was in ideal condition equipped with a massage-shower cabin. The location is perfect for those who want to visit Rome either for tourist or business purposes. The metro station is 5-10 minutes walk from the hotel. Compliments to the hotel’s staff, which was very polite, kind, spoke perfect English and always ready to give a service. For them the expression “Client is a king” is not a void sentence. It is so in this hotel. I will need to produce a long list of all good things they did for us. Therefore, I highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough”
Reviews.Author: beauty-on-the-fire
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this pleasant hotel for three nights in September of this year. I must agree with all the other reviewers as the hotel staff are extremely friendly, courteous, and efficient. The hotel is spotlessly clean, and very well kept. Although I was aware that this was a small hotel, I was still slightly disappointed as to the size of our room, which was really not quite big enough for two relatively small suitcases. Also, our room opened almost right into the reception on the ground floor, which made us feel that our comings and goings were very obvious. We also felt that we couldn't really talk in our room as people would be able to hear us in reception. I'm sure the other rooms in the hotel were more pleasant. Villa Del Parco's nightly rate was really very reasonable, but I think this is because it is so far out of the city. It is a half an hour bus journey to the centre, though the bus stop is very close to the hotel and the buses come very frequently. The biggest credit to this hotel is definitely the staff. We were caught in the rain on our last day after we had checked out, and the gentleman on reception was very kind and allowed us a place to change into dry clothes. I would recommend this hotel, but only if you don't mind the bus journies involved.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rose 0850
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful five days in Rome, staying at this lovely Hotel set in a beautiful part of the city. It was very warm in the city while we were there so it was a joy to return to this tranquil well kept Hotel. The staff from day one were very helpful, and full of good advice about getting around Rome. It was so nice to have our breakfast each morning set in the hotell gardens, which were well kept. The rooms are very well maintained and the Hotel which is an old villa a joy both inside and out. Although a little outside the centre of Rome it was so easy to get to, and after the noise and heat of the centre a real pleasure to return to each day. We had a really great stay and my husband and myself hope to return soon a really good find on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, warm and welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: Happy_fish
Reviews.Content: For a 3 star hotel, we thought this was perfect for a short stay. Short bus ride from the train station (which I thought was much nicer than having to get the metro).It's just off the main road, so not too noisy. The staff are extremly helpful and friendly. Food and drink was good, the room was clean, really cosy and comfortable. If I had to visit Rome again, I'd stay here, perfect!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful old villa with an extremely friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: bentbike
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Villa del Parco is a beautiful old villa with an extremely friendly, helpful staff. located a short distance from the big sites in Rome, but that is not a problem, there is a metro near by and a taxi is about $8 to $10 to the center of Rome. We found some great resturants near the Villa also. The room was clean and the breakfast was the best that we have had on this trip, you can order eggs if you would like. We would have no problem in returning to the Villa del Parco!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the very best”
Reviews.Author: Navassabob
Reviews.Content: For the third time I have had a delightful visit this wonderful, warm and family oriented hotel. About 10 years ago I stayed here because it was close to the office with which I was associated. About two years later I returned on a business/pleasure trip and decided to stay here again. About 10 minutes after I checked in, a maid to came to my door with two dress shirts I had forgotten on my prior trip. They had been cleaned, pressed and folded beautifully, without charge, and with no indication from me that I had intended to return. On this last visit I took my daughter, son-in-law and 9 year old granddaughter for a 9 day visit at Easter. The hotel has been refurbished and the facilities are even more inviting than before, but the staff had the same personal concern and attention to our needs, arranging tickets for the Borghese Galleria and for the Rapido to and from Florence, with no extra charge and a with genuine desire to make our visit as convenient as possible. I have stayed in fine hotels in Rome (on more than 50 visits there) and throughout the world, including the Santa Caterina in Amalfi and the Mezzatorre on Ischia, but the Hotel del Parco always comes to mind when I think of my best hotel experiences.

Reviews.Title: “4 star service at 3 star prices, location is a minus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found this from Karen Brown's website. The B&B itself is wonderful - very nice rooms, staff speak english & wait staff were helpful & friendly. The cappucino in particular is good & free (breakfash could be healthier). The neighborhood is upscale & residential so its not touristy at all. You're living in rome as the romans do. Further, the hotel is well provided for - they have a recommended cab service that was quite reasonable & they sell you metro tickets etc. They even offer umbrellas for rainy days, something you don't find in even the most upscale places in the US. Rooms can be noisy if you open the windows, otherwise peaceful. Ask for rooms in the back, not facing via nomentana. Our biggest gripe is the location. Its out of central rome & roughly 30 minutes away from anything you want to see - vatican, colosseum, spagna etc. Further, if you don't want to invest in learning the bus system then staying here can be difficult (bus sytem is notorious for pickpockets). The hotel is a 7 minute walk from the bologna metro station & there are no real restaurants/osterias or grocery stores in the vicinity. So you either walk a lot every day to the trains or you take cabs. Being frugal & paranoid re. scams, we walked but that was a little bit of a nuisance given that you spend a lot of time standing in the museums.

Reviews.Title: “A very cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very cute hotel. Its not close to the main tourist attraction but they are all accessible via the metro or taxi. The hotel amenities are good. I particularly like the staff -- very nice, friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This quaint hotel is a little out of the way from the big sites in Rome. We opted for a taxi from the train station (about $8) and around town. There is a bus station just outside the door, but taking buses in Rome is very confusing. We stayed in an older room on the first floor which was very clean and small. We were greeted by extremely friendly, helpful staff who wanted to attend to all of our needs. We were also given a complimentary bottle of champagne upon our arrival because it was our honeymoon. The buffet breakfast did not include meat, but it could be purchased. The top floor rooms are suggested because they are newer. We would stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Villa del Parco
HotelInfo.Address: Via Nomentana 110, 00161 Rome, Italy
